programme.title: An Saoghal Droil aig Pol...
programme.desc: ...Ploc/The Rubbish World of Dave Spud. 31/52. Dave discovers that his body is a musical instrument and is asked to replace a band member in his favourite group, The Whippets.

programme.title: An Saoghal Droil aig Pol...
programme.desc: ...Ploc/The Rubbish World of Dave Spud. 32/52. Grimsby is putting on its annual community play and Anna wants the role of princess.

programme.title: Clann a' Chogaidh Mhoir (Small Hands in a Big War)
programme.desc: 8/8. Drama series telling the story of WWI as seen through the eyes of children. In this episode, a young French girl and her brothers wait patiently for the war to end.

programme.title: Celtic Connections
programme.desc: 8/11. An còmhlan aig Seumas Egan a' cluich port a' sgrìobh e fhèin - B Bump Bounce. The Seumas Egan Project from the States perform one of their own tunes.

programme.title: SpeakGaelic
programme.desc: 16/26. Alison Lang chats to Joy in the studio and Calum Maclean experiences literature galore as he learns about a writer who made his home in Barra.

programme.title: An Là
programme.desc: Naidheachdan ionadail, nàiseanta is eadar-nàiseanta gach là cuide ri fiosrachadh coimhearsnachd bho BBC ALBA. Local, national and international news and information from BBC ALBA.

programme.title: Miann na Maighdinn-mara (Mermaid Tales)
programme.desc: 2/4. Kate comes across an interesting sea creature, known as a sunfish.

programme.title: Coin Trusaidh/Muster Dogs
programme.desc: 2/5. As the five-month assessment approaches, the handlers are struggling to dedicate focused time to their pups. Contains some strong language.

programme.title: Dàna | Scotland's Wild Side
programme.desc: 2/4. Coinneach MacFhraing pits himself against difficult winter conditions in one of Scotland's fearsome mountain environments.

programme.title: Eòrpa/European Current Affairs
programme.desc: 6/16. Aithris le Darren Linc bho 2017, a' rannsachadh cho bitheanta 's a tha tinneas Lyme ann an Uibhist. A 2017 report from Darren Laing, investigating Uist's high rate of Lyme disease.

programme.title: Bill agus an Spitfire
programme.desc: Bill Innes aims to fulfil a lifelong ambition to fly a Spitfire. Bill Innes gu bhith 90, le mòr-mhiann sgèith ann an Spitfire.

programme.title: Cuirm aig Celtic Connections | Valtos & Caraidean
programme.desc: 3/3. Valtos and friends in concert for Celtic Connections. Presented by Megan MacLellan.

programme.title: Hiroshima
programme.desc: Dramatic reconstruction of the devastating impact of the first atomic bomb to be used against people on the citizens of Hiroshima. Contains some scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

programme.title: Berlin 1945
programme.desc: 3/3. The British, French and Americans wait to enter Berlin. Contains scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

programme.title: Ocean Autopsy: The Secret Story of Our Seas
programme.desc: Oceanographer Dr Helen Czerski and zoologist Dr George McGavin carry out an 'autopsy' on the North Sea to understand the startling changes taking place in the world's oceans.

programme.title: A Summer Journey with Angela Rippon
programme.desc: 5/6. Angela Rippon visits Bristol's historic harbour on the day of the maritime carnival and takes a pleasure cruise through the Avon Gorge and back to the Severn Estuary.

programme.title: The Flying Archaeologist: Stonehenge
programme.desc: 1/4. Ben Robinson flies over Wiltshire to reveal new evidence about Stonehenge that explains the reason for its location and how long ago it was occupied.

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis: The Downfall
programme.desc: 3/3. In April 1945, most of Germany is occupied by invading Allied forces. As the Soviets near Hitler's hiding place, the Nazi regime starts to disintegrate.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.title: Ainsley's Taste of Malta
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott begins a culinary tour of the Mediterranean island in its capital Valletta, where he discovers why Malta is such a melting pot of cultures and the impact this has on the cuisine. Ainsley tries bell ringing, witnesses a modern take on a Maltese classic, and finds out about Maltese sausage

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Antony Cotton, Matt Dawson and Stacey Dooley 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Mother and son Becka and Connor from Johnstone in Scotland, Sylvia and Ishmail - a mother and son from Kent - and Sunderland-based Tinashe and wife Princess use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Richard from Birmingham, Jackie from East Kilbride, Emma from Hitchin and Lee from Ilkeston pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the first semi-final, which comes from Stade de Genève in Switzerland. England continue their defence of the title after they came through a nail-biting quarter-final with Sweden, fighting back from 2-0 down to take the match to penalties and winning the shootout 3-2 despite failing to score four of their spot kicks. There was also drama in Italy's last-eight contest, which saw them claim a 2-1 win against Norway, with star striker Cristiana Girelli completing her brace in second-half stoppage time

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: From the Ground Up
programme.desc: Documentary following Ian Wright's involvement in launching a girls' team at his childhood club Ten Em Bee

programme.title: Ainsley's Taste of Malta
programme.desc: The chef explores the south of Malta, beginning in Marsaxlokk where he visits the weekly fish market before heading to a nearby vineyard to hear all about the vines. After a game of Bocchi with the locals, a baker teaches Ainsley the history of the traditional Maltese bake and he takes a trip to a potato farm to find out what makes them such a popular export

programme.desc: Todd's fears for Theo prompt him to lash out at Noah, Ryan reminds Debbie of his noble intentions, Sam vanishes from Audrey's birthday meal, and Dev's clumsy remark upsets Lauren

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of a woman's quest to discover her identity, and another searching for the sister she always wanted. Paula Stillie has always looked completely different from her white adoptive family in Scotland and her search for her birth family leads across the globe, while Lisa Harding tries to fulfil her mother's dying wish and find the older sister who was given up for adoption before Lisa was born

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Creed II
programme.desc: Boxing drama starring Michael B Jordan and Sylvester Stallone. Three years after he began training with the legendary Rocky Balboa, Adonis "Donnie" Creed has taken the title of world heavyweight champion. When Russian fighter Viktor Drago, whose father Ivan killed Donnie's dad in the ring decades prior, challenges the young American to a show bout, Donnie and Rocky find their relationship strained. Can the pair work things out? And can Donnie find the inner strength to avenge his father?

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 17, which consisted of a 160.4km route from Bollene to Valence. Gary Imlach presents, with commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Tom Kerridge Cooks Spain
programme.desc: Tom is on the road in his bespoke vintage food truck in northern Spain to meet food producers who are as obsessed with growing ingredients as he is about cooking them. After local producer Levi shows him that everyone in Santona is connected to anchovies, from the fishermen and cannery workers to a group of local women who keep the town's traditions alive, Tom gets stuck in with local farmer Jose-Alonso in Leon as they try to protect white beans from the stony ground there

programme.title: The Catch...STV Player Presents
programme.desc: Crime caper about gutsy private detective Alice Vaughan, who comes home one day to find her fiance was actually a con artist who has run off with all her life savings and sensitive client information, setting her off on a revenge mission. Mireille Enos and Peter Krause star

programme.title: The Spy Who Loved Me
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Roger Moore and Barbara Bach. James Bond sets out to stop an evil shipping magnate who is capturing nuclear submarines by means of a secret tracking device. Bond finds help in the unlikely shape of a beautiful KGB agent, and a formidable enemy in steel-toothed killer Jaws.

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the first semi-final, which comes from Stade de Genève in Switzerland. England continue their defence of the title after they came through a nail-biting quarter-final with Sweden, fighting back from 2-0 down to take the match to penalties and winning the shootout 3-2 despite failing to score four of their spot kicks.
